posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, zxcvbmna12321 (that's a mouthful of a name!)!

Before we go on, might I just mention a couple of things that might help in your thinking?

First, the reason you won't see Parry taken often, if at all, is that it's broken. It simply doesn't work as intended - and I've not heard from EE users that it's been fixed. So I'd drop that like a hot brick.

Second, PvP is very different from PvM. In PvM, you're making a character that maximizes its strengths and minimizes (or at least mitigates) its shortcomings so your character can survive and best a variety of foes at a variety of levels. PvP very much relies on knowing what type of foe you will be facing. Thus, a massively critting WM would be utterly useless against a Pale Master build, and a Sneaker/HiPser would suffer against a build with True Seeing, a lower level mage facing Spell Resistant Monks ain't going far, and so on. So the builds will vary according to opponents. I think I can safely say that there is no single PvP build that will be able to handle every type of opponent. And that's why we tend not to publish them here - they're somewhat specialized, by their very nature.

And a quick question for you: is there a particular reason to cap the build at level 30? If so, are there any particular modifications that vary from "vanilla" NwN rules? Traditionally, Dexterity builds shine best in high magic environments, so knowing where you'll be playing would also help.

I say all this simply to help us in coming up with something appropriate for you, and the more details you can disclose the better - particularly for a bespoke rather than off-the-shelf build.

Hope this helps. Cheers

I mean, you could try playing  a sneaking dexer as a tank (or vice versa), but it really wouldn't go well. Thus, I hope you have progressively more fun as you go on.
How about we just try to get you a good Arelith build for now, rather than a PvP one? Play the game first, then try some player against player single combat when you're a bit more settled?
Cheers

For a straightforward dexer, how about an Elf Rogue 20 / Fighter 10, since Arelith has no EXP penalty?  Take Rogue 16 / Fighter 4 pre-epic.  Take the 19th level of Rogue at level 27 for Epic Dodge and a Tumble skill dump, and take Rogue 20 at level 30 to top off your Rogue skills.
